p: The EOCL at 100 and 200 mg/kg, i.p., significantly (p < 0.05) caused reduction in rectal temperature at 30 and 60 min post treatment compared to negative control or standard agent, diazepam (1 mg/kg) which caused significant effect at 60 min only ( Table 2). Hypothermia is an effect usually observed with benzodiazepine receptor agonists that produce this effect at relatively low doses hence the use of diazepam [39]. Hypothermia has been linked with decrease metabolic heat production and/or vasodilation. The hypothalamus has been reported to regulate body temperature, hence it could be suggested that oil may be mediating its hypothermic effect in the hypothalamus through activation of DA-D2 receptor sites [40].
